extendedInfo.description: Displays GPS and sensor data: position and signal strength of satellites, accuracy, speed, acceleration, altitude, bearing, pitch, roll and battery state.Tools included: compass with magnetic and true north, leveling tool, mark or share your location and navigate back later. Keep your GPS fast: reset it or download A-GPS data regularly for faster fixes.Visit the FAQ at: http://mobiwia.com/gpsstatusGPS Status is 100% space proof. Try to spot the program in the video below :)KNOWN FIRMWARE ISSUES (please do not report them): - Samsung phones: Because of a firmware bug, they may report extreme battery consumption for GPS Status even if it is not running at all (other programs using sensors are affected too). This is harmless and no power is consumed! Just ignore it and let's hope that a future firmware upgrade will fix this on your phone.- Droid 3: The initial Droid 3 firmware does not implement the satellite status API so you will not see the satellites and the signal strength bars. The rest of the features should work properly.- Motorola phones: On some phones, turning your phone to airplane mode will turn off the GPS receiver, too. This is a hardware limitation.- Droid Charge: Reports 0 altitude.- LG Optimus: The phone cannot report the satellite SNR values correctly (all signal bars will be maxed out).- Nexus One/S: With Andoid 2.3 it cannot report NMEA sentences. This means that the DOP/HDOP/VDOP values are not available.

reviews.title: Adding 1 Star: Version 4.1 is a welcome update
reviews.comment: I\'ve been a satisfied PRO user since early 2012 and remain pleased with the consistent improvements made by the developer. Version 4.1 adds several new features that further define the app as a premium GPS tool. It performs well on my Android 4.2.2 (JellyBean+)/3.0.68+ kernel device.  *UPDATE: still very pleased with the application\'s performance on both my handset and Nexus 7 (2013) devices. Developer remains active and consistently addresses bugs, issuing timely updates for new devices/OSes.

reviews.title: Sprint Samsung Galaxy S3
reviews.comment: I have not used this app since the update but overall this app is cool. On a recent bus trip to Atlantic City my friend was worried about the bus driver driving too fast in the rain on I-68 in WV. I downloaded this app on the bus so we could monitor the speed our bus was traveling down the mountain.
